title: Dallas Fed Names New York Fed Staffer Lorie Logan as President
sub_head: Ms. Logan will join the bank in August, filling the spot vacated by Robert Kaplan last year
body:
Lorie Logan, who manages the Federal Reserve Bank of New Yorkâ€™s massive holdings of securities and cash, will be the new president and chief executive of the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas.
Ms. Logan, a 49-year-old executive vice president at the New York Fed, will take over the slot vacated by Robert Kaplan in September. He retired from the Dallas Fed amid questions about trading in financial markets during his tenure at the bank.
